intro: Matelea ampiyacuensis, commonly known as the Ampiyacu mountainflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and rocky slopes. Matelea ampiyacuensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar to pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees.
